main event: On 7 October 1957, a bright light with tails or a tail was observed falling in the sky 10 miles southwest of Houlton, Maine. The observation lasted for 3 minutes and 5 seconds and no sound was heard.
interesting points: The observation strongly suggests a meteor or satellite.
The object emitted sparks and had a long tail.
It disappeared from view after emitting a flash.
The observation was made by Captain Smith, a pilot from the 69th Bomb Wing.
The report indicates that there were no other corroborating observations from aircraft.
sighted object: bright light with tails or tail falling from the sky
witnesses: Captain Smith, a pilot from the 69th Bomb Wing
